result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D. Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  185 days sentence credit to be applied if probation is revoked.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph D. Rose in court, in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states reasons we are here.  DE wishes to proceed w/o counsel.  Court accepts that.  Motion to revoke DPA on Ct 1 and probation on Cts 2 and 3.  Court questions how any credit DE would have could be applied.  Recess for State to talk about settlement w/DE since he doesn't have counsel.  Back on the record, Court questions DE again re: counsel.  DE says he thought he was going to get a public defender and would now like to speak to one.  Court notes one of the pleas is to a felony and he's concerned about DE representing himself due to that.  DE still wants to represent himself but is wondering how long he would have to wait to get back into court if he gets counsel.  DE decides he does want to proceed today w/o counsel.  State states her understanding as to what will happen today.  She talked to DOC and they are asking two years probation as the drug court recommendations are a minimum of 18 months.  DE states he agrees w/statement by State and he did read the drug court agreement and reviewed that w/the drug court coordinator.  State recommends 6 months jail on Ct 2 and 30 days consecutive on Ct 3.  DE doesn't object to revocation of DPA on Ct and the Court orders DPA revoked on Ct 1 and finds DE guilty on Ct 1.  State recommends two years probation, $518.00, AODA/treatment and any other counseling/treatment recommendations per agent.  Believes DE will be or already has been enrolled in drug court program.  DE is in agreement and has nothing to add.  DE will agree to drug court as a condition of probation.  Court advises DE re: voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearms warnings.


Ct 1:  
Probation for two years
Conditions of probation:
AODA/assessment/treatment and any other AODA/Treatment/Counseling per agent
Participate in and comply w/SCDCP
DNA sample to be provided
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
185 days credit to be applied ONLY if revoked
Ct 2:  
5 months jail w/huber concurrent to Ct 3
Ct 3:  
30 days jail w/huber concurrent to Ct 2
113 days credit to be applied for TIME served

Unpaid costs/surcharges to be included in the payment plan set up w/COC's office
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on August 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on August 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on August 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
to revoke DPA
extending DPA

Full time employment or schooling.

Paperwork handed in court.

Ct. withholds adj. of guilt. Deferred Prosecution Ordered on Ct. 1; filed agreement today.  Review scheduled for January 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.
